intro: Aria szovitsii, commonly known as the Hungarian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along streambanks, preferring well-drained soil. Aria szovitsii has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators.
